info.game_comments:
2001 Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 4.
From the Pennsylvania Convention Center in Philadelphia.

(1, 1).clue: Of the Loire, the Seine or the Drome, the river that runs through a national capital city

(3, 1).clue: A squirrel uses this fluffy appendage for balance when it leaps & climbs

(5, 1).clue: On this date in separate years "America" was first sung publicly and "America the Beautiful" was first published

(1, 2).clue: Of the Shannon, the Boyne or the Mackenzie, the river that's not in Ireland

(6, 3).clue: Bart Simpson once observed of a show that he didn't think it was possible, but it "both sucks and" does this

(3, 4).clue: Some of these fleshy growths that top roosters' heads are V-shaped & some look like a walnut

(5, 4).clue: In 1825, 50 years after this June 17, 1775 battle, the Marquis de Lafayette helped dedicate a monument to it

(2, 5).clue: It's the New York City coffee house where the "Friends" gang hangs out

(4, 5).clue: Yiddish term for a thin pancake folded around a filling of cottage & cream cheese

(2, 1).clue: When dissecting something in biology, that bad odor may be this preservative derived from methyl alcohol

(3, 1).clue: So far it's had 16 chief justices, starting with John Jay & ending with William Rehnquist

(2, 2).clue: This appropriately-named insect uses its disagreeable odor to protect itself from enemies

(2, 3).clue: Skunk musk is actually an organic compound of this element, symbol S
